title: JAL Cargo Fuel Surcharge from the Month of October 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
JAL Cargo Fuel Surcharge from the Month of October 2015 Published
Japan Airlines (JAL) has applied to the Japanese Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism (MLIT) to revise its international cargo fuel surcharge for flights departing from Japan from October 1,2015.
Since April 1, 2009, JAL started adjusting its cargo fuel surcharge levels on a monthly basis by using the one-month average fuel price of Singapore kerosene of the month before last. As the average fuel price of Singapore kerosene for the month of August in 2015 was US$57.25 per barrel, the benchmark fuel price used for calculation of the fuel surcharge level will be within the range of US$55.00 to US$59.99 per barrel (refer to table below).
The international cargo fuel surcharge will therefore be 31 yen per kg on long-haul international routes, 21 yen per kg on medium-haul international routes, and 13 yen on short-haul routes.
International Cargo Surcharge
Benchmark Fuel Price Range
(US$/bbl) Surcharge by Route (per kg) 1.Long-haul Routes
Japan – Americas, Europe,
Middle East, Africa 2. Medium-haul Routes
All routes other than those mentioned in 1 & 3 3. Short-haul Routes
